name: Orbifold Tutte Embeddings
body: #Orbifold Tutte Embeddings ## Noam Aigerman & Yaron Lipman ### Matlab code implementing the [Siggraph Asia 2015 paper, "Orbifold Tutte Embeddings"](http://www.wisdom.weizmann.ac.il/~noamaig/html/projects/orbifold/orbifold_highres.pdf). An extension of Tutte's embedding for spheres and other topologies: a mesh is cut open, and embedded with appropriate boundary conditions so that the resulting embedding can tile the plane and yield a tiling which is discrete-harmonic everywhere. The embedding is thus guaranteed to be bijective, and also seamless in the sense that modifying the cuts yields the same tiling. ![](https://github.com/noamaig/euclidean_orbifolds/raw/gh-pages/images/david.png) It is also a discrete approximation of a conformal map: and can be used to generate a map between two surfaces: ![](https://github.com/noamaig/euclidean_orbifolds/raw/gh-pages/images/map.gif) and also to create seamless symmetric patterns:
